comment.text: This translation key is used to display an error message when authentication fails due to missing assertion attributes. It is likely displayed in a login form or authentication dialog, notifying users that their credentials are invalid. The translator should consider the tone and nuance of this phrase to convey a clear and informative error message to users.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'təsdiq atributları tapılmadı' is a literal translation of 'assertion attributes not found' which is not the most natural or understandable way to express the error in Azerbaijani. 'Assertion' is a technical term that might not be clear to the user.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more user-friendly phrasing like 'Təsdiq məlumatları tapılmadı' (Confirmation information not found) or 'Təsdiq üçün zəruri məlumatlar yoxdur' (Necessary information for confirmation is not available).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The German translation "Authentifizierung fehlgeschlagen" is too short and doesn't convey the full meaning of the English content "Authentication failed (assertion attributes not found)". It simply states 'Authentication failed' and misses the crucial detail about the missing assertion attributes.
The phrase 'no se han encontrado' is grammatically correct, but slightly less natural in this context. A more common and smoother phrasing would be 'no se encontraron'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Error de autenticación (atributos de aserción no se encontraron)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "affirmation des attributs" is not the standard or most accurate translation of "assertion attributes." "Assertion" in this context refers to a security token assertion. A more accurate translation would convey that meaning.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Echec d'authentification (attributs de l'assertion non trouvés)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation '属性値アサーションが見つかりません' is a literal translation of 'assertion attributes not found' but doesn't convey the meaning clearly in Japanese. A more natural phrasing would be something indicating the necessary attributes were missing from the authentication assertion.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 認証に失敗しました（必要な属性がアサーションに含まれていません）

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The parentheses and explanation '（...）' are appropriate, but a more common way to phrase this in Japanese technical documentation would be to use a colon. This improves readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 認証に失敗しました：必要な属性がアサーションに含まれていません

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation '어설션 속성을 찾을 수 없습니다' is a literal translation of 'assertion attributes not found'. While understandable, a more natural Korean phrasing would be '인증 요청에 필요한 속성을 찾을 수 없습니다' or '인증 요청에 필요한 속성 정보가 누락되었습니다'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 인증 요청에 필요한 속성을 찾을 수 없습니다

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation 'ການກວດສອບບໍ່ສຳເລັດ (ບໍ່ພົບຄຸນສົມບັດການຢືນຢັນ)' is a literal translation but doesn't quite capture the nuanced meaning of 'Authentication failed (assertion attributes not found)'. A more natural translation for a technical context might focus on the reason for the failure.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ການຢັ້ງຢືນບໍ່ສຳເລັດເນື່ອງຈາກບໍ່ພົບຂໍ້ມູນທີ່ຕ້ອງມີໃນການຢັ້ງຢືນ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation of "assertion attributes" is not ideal. "Bevestigingskenmerken" is quite literal and may not be the most natural phrasing for a Dutch speaker. It lacks the conciseness and clarity of the English original.
The Romanian translation uses the singular 'nu s-a găsit' which doesn't grammatically agree with 'atributele'. It should be plural to match.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Autentificare nereușită (atributele aserțiunii nu au fost găsite)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'ප්‍රකාශන උපලක්‍ෂණ හමු නොවිණි' (prakāśana upalakṣaṇa hamu naviṇi) while conveying a similar concept, isn't the most natural or precise translation of 'assertion attributes'. A more accurate and idiomatic rendering of 'assertion attributes' would be something like 'අන්තර්ගත ගුණාංග' (anthargatha gunaang). The overall message would be better conveyed as 'ඔප්තීකරණ ගුණාංග නොමැතීමෙන් හේතුවක්'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: බලය දීමට අසමත් විය (ඔප්තීකරණ ගුණාංග නොමැතීමෙන් හේතුවක්)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Preverjanje ni uspelo (potrditvenih atributov ni mogoče najti)' is a literal translation but doesn't quite capture the nuance of 'assertion attributes not found'.  A more natural and technically accurate phrasing would be preferable.

While the translation is understandable, "атрибути тврдње нису пронађени" is a very literal and somewhat awkward translation of "assertion attributes." A more natural Serbian phrasing might be "непознати атрибути у аутентификационој тврдњи" or "недефинисани атрибути у аутентификационој тврдњи".
The word 'Neuspela' is missing a diacritic. It should be 'Neuspešna'.

The translation 'không tìm thấy thuộc tính xác nhận' is a literal translation of 'assertion attributes not found' and doesn't convey the intended meaning of a failed authentication due to missing attributes. 'Xác nhận' (confirmation) isn't the best equivalent for 'assertion' in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Xác thực không thành công (thiếu thuộc tính xác thực) or Xác thực không thành công (thiếu thông tin xác thực).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, 'thuộc tính xác nhận' is a bit stiff and less natural in Vietnamese. 'Thuộc tính' can be shortened to 'thông tin' for a smoother flow.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using 'thông tin' instead of 'thuộc tính' for a more natural-sounding translation.
